required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: the Study to Evaluate the Safety of UB-421 in Combination With Antiretroviral Therapy (ART) and the Efficacy in Reduction of HIV Viral Load and Proviral DNA as Compared to ART Alone in ART-experienced Viremic HIV-1 Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II, Open-label, Controlled, Proof-of-concept Study to Evaluate the Safety of UB-421 in Combination With Antiretroviral Therapy (ART) and the Efficacy in Reduction of HIV Viral Load and Proviral DNA as Compared to ART Alone in ART-experienced Viremic HIV-1 Patients

brief_summary.textblock: This study assess the safety, tolerability, and efficacy in reducing viral load and proviral DNA of UB-421 administered as an add-on to the ART in ART-experienced viremic HIV-1 subjects.

clinical_study.why_stopped: The study will not be submitted to authority for IND application.

primary_outcome.description: the incidence of Grade 3 drug-related treatment-emergent adverse events

arm_group.description: ART plus weekly UB-421 IV infusion at 5 mg/kg dose level for 16 weeks

intervention.description: Monoclonal antibody by IV infusion plus standard ART

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. HIV-1 seropositive
2. Male with body weight ≥ 50 kg or female with body weight ≥ 45 kg.
3. have been receiving antiretroviral therapy (ART) for more than 2 years
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Any previous exposure to a mAb within 12 weeks prior to the first dose of UB-421 treatment.
2. Any significant diseases (other than HIV-1 infection) or clinically significant findings, including psychiatric and behavioral problems, determined during the screening period, medical history, and/or physical examination that, in Investigator's opinion, would preclude the subject from participating in this study.
3. History of anaphylaxis to monoclonal antibodies.
4. Any vaccination within 8 weeks prior to the first dose of UB-421.
